intro: Echium fontanesii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre lovegrass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stem. Echium fontanesii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
